                            <div class="title">Customize Your Weather</div>
                            <div>
                                <label for="adv_wlocation_input">Set Your Location:</label>
                                <div class="errorMsg"></div>
                            </div>
                            <div class="advFrmInput"><input name="adv_wlocation_input" id="adv_wlocation_input" type="text" value="" placeholder="Enter City and State or Zip Code" /></div>
                            <div class="advFrmBtn"><input type="submit" value="Submit" /></div>
                        </form>

                        <div id="adv_wlocation_confirm">
                            <div class="title">Congratulations!</div>
                            <div>Your weather is set to <span class="advGeoChoosen"></span>. You can change the location at any time.</div>
                            <div class="advFrmBtn">
                                <input class="adv-tray_link" data-state="4" data-phase="phase3" type="button" value="Done" />
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <div id="adv_weather_data">
                            <div class="subtitle">AccuWeather.com Quick Look</div>
                            <div class="title"></div>
                            <div><a class="advTrayLink" data-state="2" data-phase="phase1">Change your current location &raquo;</a></div>
                            <div class="advWeatherInner"></div>
                            <div class="advFrmBtn"><a class="advABtn" href="">View Full Weather Report</a></div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="adunit nomobilead" id="SponsorRight"></div>
    </div>

    
    <div id="adv_mast_right">

    
    <div id="adv_search" class="advToprailBtn" data-state="6">

    function getToprailVersion() { return 1; }
    function getComscorekwValue() {

    <div role="main" id="main">
      
      
      <div class="wrapper">
        <div id="content">
          <div class="hnews">
            <div id="article">
              <div class="wrapper">
                                  <div class="social_sidebar sticky">
                    <div class="CommentCount">
                      <a href="#comments"><span id="echo_comment_count"></span></a>
                      <div class="label">comments</div>
                    </div>
	                
                    	<div id="social_share_desktop"></div><!-- /social_share_desktop -->
                    
                  </div>


                <!-- headline - wide -->	
<!-- Premium Blog -->

<!-- /Premium Blog -->
<h1>Martellus Bennett free agency rumors: 'Real possibility' Patriots tight end signs elsewhere (report)</h1>
<div class="clearfix"></div>
<!-- /headline -->

                <div id="article_container">
                    <div id="top_images"><div><span class="resimg  adv-photo-large" data-image="http://media.masslive.com/patriots/photo/22122101-mmmain.jpg" data-position="article-main" />Martellus Bennett</span></div><div class="Caption">
               
                    New England Patriots Martellus Bennett is interviewed on the field after a win against the Atlanta Falcons at Super Bowl 51 on Sunday, February 5, 2017 in Houston, TX. (AP Photo/Gregory Payan)
                
                
                    
                        <em>(Gregory Payan)</em></div></div>
    


                    


<!--  -->

<div id="Byline">
	<div class="EmailPrint">
		<a class="PrintLink" href="javascript:window.print();">Print</a>
		<a class="EmailLink" href="mailto:?subject=Martellus%20Bennett%20free%20agency%20rumors%3A%20%27Real%20possibility%27%20Patriots%20tight%20end%20signs%20elsewhere%20%28report%29&body=http%3A%2F%2Fblog.masslive.com%2Fpatriots%2F2017%2F02%2Fmartellus_bennett_free_agency.html#incart_email ">Email</a>
	</div>
	
	




	
		<a href="http://connect.masslive.com/user/kddillon/index.html">
			
			   <span class="resimg Avatar" id="avatar_author" data-image="http://media.masslive.com/avatars/11723892.png" data-position="byline-avatar">Kevin Dillon | kdillon@masslive.com</span>
			
		</a>
	



	



By

	
		
	
		
			<span class="author vcard"><a class="bl" id="name_author" href="http://connect.masslive.com/user/kddillon/posts.html">
	
		
	
	
	
	
	Kevin Dillon | kdillon@masslive.com
</a></span>
		
	
<span style="display:none; visibility:hidden;">masslive.com</span>
		<br /> <a id="email_author" onclick="emailAuthor()">Email the author</a> | <a id="twitter_author" href="https://twitter.com/kddillon219" target="_blank">Follow on Twitter</a>
	




	<br/>on February 22, 2017 at 11:09 AM, updated <span class="updated" title="2017-02-22T16:10:41Z">February 22, 2017 at 11:10 AM</span>
	<div id="sponsor_tablet">  
		<div class="sub-sponsor"></div>
	</div>
</div><!-- /Byline -->


                    <div id="social_top">
                    </div><!-- /social_top -->

                    <div id="social_mobile">
                        <div id="social_share_phone"></div>
                        <div class="CommentCount">
                          <a href="#comments"><span id="echo_comment_count_mobile"></span> <span class="label">comments</span></a>
                        </div>
                    </div><!-- /social_mobile -->  

                    
                    
                    <script type="text/javascript">

   Advance.Gigya.settings.page = {
            'title':'Martellus Bennett free agency rumors: \'Real possibility\' Patriots tight end signs elsewhere (report)',
            'link':'http://blog.masslive.com/patriots/2017/02/martellus_bennett_free_agency.html',
            'desc': 'There is a \'real possibility\' Martellus Bennett leaves in free agency, according to NFL Media\'s Ian Rapoport.',
	    'thumbnail': 'http://media.masslive.com/patriots/photo/22122101-standard.jpg'
   };

</script>



                    
                    
                    
                    <div id="article_inset">
                      <div id="story-package" >
                        <!-- series -->


<!-- /series -->

 <!-- Aka Story Package -->
                        <!-- gallery-preview -->
<!-- /gallery-preview -->
 <!-- Aka Secondary Package -->
                        <div class="adunit nomobilead" id="StoryAd"></div>

                      </div><!-- /storypackage -->
                    </div><!-- /#article_inset -->
                    <!-- Article -->
	
	<div class="entry-content">

		
		<div class="ndn_embed" id="ndn-video-player-1" data-config-distributor-id="90298"></div>

		<p>The first year of Martellus Bennett was certainly a fun one in New England. He won a Super Bowl, caught seven touchdown passes and <a href="http://blog.masslive.com/patriots/2017/02/super_bowl_2017_martellus_benn_6.html">provided countless hilarious quotes from the locker room</a>.</p>
<p>However, there may not be a second year. According to a report from NFL Media's Ian Rapoport, Bennett may be on his way out in free agency this offseason.</p>
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p dir="ltr" lang="en"><a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/Patriots?src=hash">#Patriots</a> TE Martellus Bennett will test free agency. Based on his asking price &amp; likely offers, it's a real possibility he exits, I'm told</p>
-- Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) <a href="https://twitter.com/RapSheet/status/834194620674371585">February 22, 2017</a></blockquote>
<script async="" src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script>
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p dir="ltr" lang="en">The <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/Patriots?src=hash">#Patriots</a> helped Martellus Bennett revive his career, and it's a mutually respectful relationship. But keeping him in NE will be hard</p>
-- Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) <a href="https://twitter.com/RapSheet/status/834194770713014274">February 22, 2017</a></blockquote>
<p>
<script async="" src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script>
</p>
<p>Bennett, who is one of the more outspoken players in the league, responded on Twitter later in the night.</p>
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p dir="ltr" lang="en">I haven't given free agency a ton of thought at this moment to be truly honest. I've been in MartyLand creating for <a href="https://twitter.com/ImaginationAgcy">@ImaginationAgcy</a></p>
-- Martellus Bennett (@MartysaurusRex) <a href="https://twitter.com/MartysaurusRex/status/834207856106799108">February 22, 2017</a></blockquote>
<p>
<script async="" src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script>
</p>
<p>Bennett played his way into a big contract this past season. He is arguably the best tight end on the market, and is in for at least one more pay day in his NFL career, considering he is 30 years old.</p>
<p>MassLive's Kevin Duffy did a complete breakdown of Bennett's negotiations. Read more about that below.</p>
<p><a href="http://blog.masslive.com/patriots/2017/02/martellus_bennett_patriots_fre.html#incart_river_index" data-enhanced="small"></a></p>
		
		

		
		<div class="ndn_embed" id="ndn-video-player-2" data-config-distributor-id="90298"></div>

	</div>
<!-- /Article -->

                  <div class="box_grayoutline">
  <div>
        <div class="box_top_left"><!-- --></div><div class="box_top_right"><!-- --></div><div class="box_top"><!-- --></div>

  </div>

  </div>
</div>
